title: Losing borders in table cells
content: In <style> I have td {padding:.5ch;border:solid, grey, thin; text-align:center} Suddenly the borders stopped working, but still work in other Browsers. I added <thead> to the table and thead {display: table-header-group;} in the @media print in the style section, but removing them doedn't
creator: howardcarymorris2

title: Doesn't load pages of a commercial site correctly
content:
Equipment: Mac using Ventura 13.7.5 Website: www.jewelosco.com (supermarket in Chicago area)

Main page loads fine but when a category is selected and then a SUB CATEGORY is selected, it shows the page as it should but says "0" items available.

Firefox worked flawlessly for years with the website until several weeks ago when this problem began. I spoke to the Jewel foods help center and they said it was a browser issue. This was proven correct when, at their suggestion, I try using Safari. I did and the website functioned correctly.

I have been a very loyal Firefox user for over 15 years. I hate to think this problem would force me to migrate to Safari. Please help !

Ed K edkarleski@gmail com (missing "i" intentional)
creator: edkarleski

title: Firefoz Home / New Tab Is Static; can't save websites or most recent
content:
Previously, recent websites, and pinned websites would show on the Firefox Home / New Tab page. Now, it is completely blank, except for three rows of blank boxes, which are unresponsive, a search entry, which works, and a weather app with menu.

I've searched and searched for a solution, find limited cases previously, but no solutions.
creator: myrnawein

title: Firefox Settings
content: I can't access "settings." When I click "Settings" a faint shadow around the edges of my screen appears, but the actual page does not load. Sometimes, Firefox itself won't open for several days so I've had to start using an alternate browser when this happens. Is this a known issue?
creator: dgray96292

title: Default Location
content: where can I set my default location in Firefox? Windows 10 (desktop) has removed Maps so the computer's default location cannot be determined, and now Google Maps in Firefox has the wrong location for this computer
creator: wansb

title: Settings
content: Hi. I changed my default to Firefox but when I open a tab that darn Yahoo keeps coming up. I restarted my computer and everything. How can I get Firefox to be my search engine?
